title: Plas yn Rhiw - Gwynedd Walking Route

images.title: Plas yn Rhiw by David Brown, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Plas yn Rhiw. National Trust property with a fine view over Porth Neigwl. The exterior looks 18th century, but much of the interior is 16th & 17th century. Rescued from decay by the slightly eccentric Keating sisters of Nottingham in the 1930's.

images.title: Garden at Plas-yn-Rhiw by David Gearing, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Garden at Plas-yn-Rhiw

images.title: The front garden at Plas yn Rhiw by Eric Jones, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The front garden

images.title: Hill slope flat land boundary below Plas yn Rhiw by Eric Jones, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Hill slope flat land boundary below Plas yn Rhiw

description: This walk takes you to this National Trust owned 17th century manor house in Rhiw, Gwynedd. The house is surrounded by beautiful ornamental gardens, woodland trails and grounds. The route takes you around the house on footpaths and country lanes with simply stunning views of Cardigan Bay, Hell's Mouth and the and the Llyn Peninsula. In Ferbruary you can see lots of pretty snowdrops as displayed in the video below.
